definition.name: CC-PSPACE
definition.formal: CC-PSPACE = { P : solvable in O(poly N) coordination rounds }

containment.proof_summary: CC-PH SUBSET CC_log SUBSET CC_poly = CC-PSPACE

separation.proof_summary: CC-PH has finite height, CC-PSPACE has poly depth, poly > finite
separation.witness: COORDINATION-GAME(N) IN CC-PSPACE but NOT IN CC-PH

completeness.proof_summary: Membership: O(poly N) rounds. Hardness: Protocol simulation

vs_cc_log.proof_summary: log N < poly N, COORDINATION-GAME witnesses

hierarchy.containment_chain: CC_0 < CC-NP < CC-PH < CC_log < CC-PSPACE < CC_exp
hierarchy.key_insight: Coordination hierarchy MORE RESOLVED than classical

crash_failure.key_insight:
Under crash-failure:
- CC-PH collapses to CC-NP (Phase 50)
- But CC-PSPACE does NOT collapse
- COORDINATION-GAME still requires poly rounds
- Therefore CC-NP STRICT_SUBSET CC-PSPACE under crash-failure too

byzantine.cc_pspace_definition: Same: O(poly N) rounds with Byzantine tolerance
byzantine.key_insight:
Under Byzantine:
- CC-PH is strict hierarchy (Phase 50)
- CC-PH still has finite height
- CC-PSPACE allows unbounded (poly) depth
- Separation is even more pronounced
byzantine.complete_problems: Same, but with Byzantine tolerance requirements

partial_synchrony.key_insight:
Under partial synchrony:
- Rounds may be asynchronous (GST model)
- CC-PSPACE = O(poly N) rounds after GST
- Separation likely preserved

comparison_to_classical.reason: CC-PH has finite height, CC-PSPACE has poly depth

new_questions_details.question: Is there a CC-L (coordination log-space) class?
new_questions_details.description:
Classical L (log-space) is contained in P. What is the coordination
analog? CC-L might be problems solvable with O(log N) local state
per node, regardless of rounds. How does CC-L relate to CC_0?

new_questions_details.question: Is CC-PSPACE = CC-NPSPACE?
new_questions_details.description:
Classically, PSPACE = NPSPACE (Savitch's theorem). Does the same
hold for coordination? If CC-PSPACE = problems with polynomial
resources, does adding nondeterminism help?

new_questions_details.question: What is the parallel coordination complexity?
new_questions_details.description:
We've analyzed sequential rounds. What if nodes can run parallel
coordination protocols? Define CC-NC (coordination Nick's Class).
Is there a CC-NC hierarchy like classical NC?

new_questions_details.question: Are there natural CC-PSPACE-intermediate problems?
new_questions_details.description:
Are there problems in CC-PSPACE that are not CC-PSPACE-complete
and not in CC-PH? These would be CC-PSPACE-intermediate, analogous
to graph isomorphism for NP.

new_questions_details.question: Can we characterize CC-PSPACE by games more precisely?
new_questions_details.description:
We showed COORDINATION-GAME is CC-PSPACE-complete. Can we
characterize CC-PSPACE as exactly those problems expressible
as polynomial-depth coordination games? (Like PSPACE = AP)

summary.answer: YES, CC-PSPACE exists and CC-PH STRICT_SUBSET CC-PSPACE
summary.key_result: We can PROVE CC-PH != CC-PSPACE (unlike classical PH vs PSPACE)
summary.significance: Coordination complexity is MORE RESOLVED than classical complexity
